wikipedia_page.main:
Ivo Francis Walter Bligh, 8th Earl of Darnley,  (13 March 1859 – 10 April 1927), styled Hon. Ivo Bligh until 1900, lord of the Manor of Cobham, Kent, was a British noble, parliamentarian and cricketer.
Bligh captained the England team in the first ever Test cricket series against Australia with The Ashes at stake in 1882/83.Later in life, he inherited the earldom of Darnley and sat at Westminster as an elected Irish representative peer.

response: |Ivo Bligh, 8th Earl of Darnley||10 March 1905||Cornwallis Maude, 1st Earl de Montalt||10 April 1927
